ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: an advanced-level "introduction" to continuous time finance and asset pricing. for econ students interested in this course, the focus is very different from economics courses in terms of the types of questions asked and answered. thetools you gain will be valuable in helping you approach economics problems, but the course is very much focused on finance-and-not-economics questions. that said, because there are no problem sets, it takes more work than usual to develop the tools covered in class.
I highly recommend this course, especially for those with strong math backgrounds. It will deepen your knowledge of continuous time finance no matter your starting level of knowledge.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: i learned a lot about how modern finance is done and I developed the tools needed to solve these types of problems. as I will not be studying finance, this class did not contribute to my research directly, though I am confident that the methods of valuing stochastic "assets" will be useful in other areas of economics as well.
